p: Based on three patients infected by human H7N9, the constructed phylogenetic trees of NA genes showed H7N9, H2N9, or H11N9 as its origin. However, the Korean H7 subtype was suggested as the origin of highly pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) H7N9 2013 [ 13]. H7N9 AIV has all three of its genes reasserted: hemagglutinin (HA) gene derived from H7N3, NA gene potentially from H7N9, H2N9, or H11N9 and six internal genes derived from H9N2 viruses [ 13]. Furthermore, the pandemic human H2N2 subtype (1957) originated upon reassortment between a previously circulating seasonal human A/H1N1 virus and an avian A/H2N2 virus [ 14].
